title: Unable to compile native image when using quarkus-openshift-client or quarkus-kubernetes-client
body:
### Describe the bug

I am trying to compile to native a Quarkus program with

- Dependencies
  - quarkus-resteasy-jsonb
  - quarkus-resteasy
  - quarkus-rest-client
  - quarkus-arc
  - quarkus-picocli
  - quarkus-openshift-client
  - quarkus-smallrye-health
  - quarkus-scheduler
 - Quarkus version: 2.4.1.Final
 - Image used to build: quay.io/quarkus/ubi-quarkus-native-s2i:21.2.0-java11

Compiling to uber-jar works fine, but compiling to native ends up with this error:
```
[WARNING] [io.quarkus.deployment.steps.ReflectiveHierarchyStep] Unable to properly register the hierarchy of the following classes for reflection as they are not in the Jandex index:
	- okhttp3.Call (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
	- okhttp3.OkHttpClient (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
	- okhttp3.ResponseBody (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
	- okhttp3.TlsVersion (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
	- okhttp3.WebSocket (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
	- okhttp3.WebSocketListener (source: PicocliNativeImageProcessor)
Consider adding them to the index either by creating a Jandex index for your dependency via the Maven plugin, an empty META-INF/beans.xml or quarkus.index-dependency properties.
[INFO] [io.quarkus.deployment.pkg.steps.JarResultBuildStep] Building native image source jar: /tmp/src/k8scontroller/target/k8scontroller-1.0.0-native-image-source-jar/k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner.jar
[INFO] [io.quarkus.deployment.pkg.steps.NativeImageBuildStep] Building native image from /tmp/src/k8scontroller/target/k8scontroller-1.0.0-native-image-source-jar/k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner.jar
[INFO] [io.quarkus.deployment.pkg.steps.NativeImageBuildStep] Running Quarkus native-image plugin on GraalVM 21.2.0 Java 11 CE (Java Version 11.0.12+6-jvmci-21.2-b08)
[INFO] [io.quarkus.deployment.pkg.steps.NativeImageBuildRunner] /opt/graalvm/bin/native-image -J-Dsun.nio.ch.maxUpdateArraySize=100 -J-Djava.util.logging.manager=org.jboss.logmanager.LogManager -J-Dvertx.logger-delegate-factory-class-name=io.quarkus.vertx.core.runtime.VertxLogDelegateFactory -J-Dvertx.disableDnsResolver=true -J-Dio.netty.leakDetection.level=DISABLED -J-Dio.netty.allocator.maxOrder=3 -J-Duser.language=en -J-Duser.country=US -J-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -H:InitialCollectionPolicy=com.oracle.svm.core.genscavenge.CollectionPolicy\$BySpaceAndTime -H:+JNI -H:+AllowFoldMethods -H:FallbackThreshold=0 -H:+ReportExceptionStackTraces -H:-AddAllCharsets -H:EnableURLProtocols=http,https -H:+InlineBeforeAnalysis -H:NativeLinkerOption=-no-pie -H:-UseServiceLoaderFeature -H:+StackTrace k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner -jar k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner.jar
[k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner:243]    classlist:   8,853.06 ms,  1.20 GB
[k8scontroller-1.0.0-runner:243]        (cap):     588.82 ms,  1.20 GB

The bundle named: messages, has not been found. If the bundle is part of a module, verify the bundle name is a fully qualified class name. Otherwise verify the bundle path is accessible in the classpath.

Error: com.oracle.graal.pointsto.constraints.UnsupportedFeatureException: Detected an instance of Random/SplittableRandom class in the image heap. Instances created during image generation have cached seed values and don't behave as expected.  To see how this object got instantiated use --trace-object-instantiation=java.util.Random. The object was probably created by a class initializer and is reachable from a static field. You can request class initialization at image runtime by using the option --initialize-at-run-time=<class-name>. Or you can write your own initialization methods and call them explicitly from your main entry point.

Or you can write your own initialization methods and call them explicitly from your main entry point.
